definition[0]: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc
example[0]: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
example[1]: Staff members are trained by their peers.
definition[1]: a member of the British nobility
definition[2]: to look very carefully at something, especially because you are having difficulty seeing it
example[2]: He was peering through the wet windscreen at the cars ahead.
definition[3]: a company or product that is similar to the one you are talking about
example[4]: He believes the company is undervalued relative to its peers.
definition[4]: someone who is the same age or has the same job, social position etc as the person you are talking about
